title.narrative: HEALTHY NUTRITION

description.narrative: National partners strengthen their intersectoral coordination, implementation and monitoring mechanisms to (a) reduce all forms of malnutrition among children and (b) address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating women., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, every newborn, child, adolescent and woman of reproductive age in Turkmenistan, especially those most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from equitable access to high-impact and quality health, nutrition and early childhood development (ECD) services.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND MEDICAL INDUSTRY OF TURKMENISTAN
SCIENTIFIC AND CLINICAL CENTER OF MOTHER AND CHILD HEALTH

sector.narrative: Maternal nutrition, including counselling, micronutrient supplementation and dietary support
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting and wasting (excludes intervention specific strategies)
Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (early childhood nutrition)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National partners strengthen their intersectoral coordination, implementation and monitoring mechanisms to (a) reduce all forms ofmalnutrition among children; and (b) address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating women.

description.narrative: Government-UNICEF support in 2021 expanded the Baby-Friendly Hospitals Initiative, strengthened awareness and capacity on Infant and Young Child Feeding among health care workers, and ensured ongoing flour fortification and salt iodization monitoring, which in effect, contributed to continuation of essential nutrition services in times of the pandemic. ;While preparations are in place, the National Micronutrient Survey implementation has been rescheduled to 2022. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of health and nutrition workers trained to provide anemia prevention and adolescent nutrition counselling services as per national standards, Number

Implementation of programmes to improve diet diversity in children, Text

baseline.value: Score 1: There is a draft of a new national Nutrition strategy for that includes prevention and interventions aimed at reduction of stunting in children under five years of age

target.value: 2025:Score 4. Government implement 6 (1,3,4,5,8,9) programmes, targeting improvement of nutrition status of children of 6-23 months.

actual.value: 2021:Score 2. Partially. Programme components 1 and 8 implemented to promote diverse diets for children aged 6-23 months
